oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Weighing matrices and optical quantum computing
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Flammia, Steven T.
Severini, Simone
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quantum Physics
Mathematics - Combinatorics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Quantum computation in the one-way model requires the preparation of certain resource states known as cluster states. We describe how the construction of continuous-variable cluster states for optical quantum computing relate to the existence of certain families of matrices. The relevant matrices are known as weighing matrices, with a few additional constraints. We prove some results regarding the structure of these matrices, and their associated graphs.
